The confider in falshood confounded. Being an answer to an abusive book lately published by William Wright of Dublin, against Thomas Carleton his tenant in the first place: And Will. Edmondson, John Burnyet, Abraham Fuller, and Franc. Randall, arbitrators, in the second place; equally chosen to end some difference between the said William Wright and Thomas Carleton, &c. Carleton, Tho. (Thomas)
24 [i.e. 30] p.
s.n.], [S.l. : printed in the year of our Lord 1684.
Various letters within text signed: T.C., Tho. Carleton. Reproduction of original in the Haverford College Library.
=======
